annotation.spannedText: The vaccine gives protection against the hepatitis B virus, which is a major cause of serious liver disease, including cirrhosis and liver cancer

classMention.mentionClass: The vaccine gives protection against the hepatitis B virus, which is a major cause of serious liver disease, including cirrhosis and liver cancer

annotation.spannedText: If your job places you at risk of hepatitis B infection, it is your employer's responsibility to arrange vaccination for you, rather than your GP

classMention.mentionClass: If your job places you at risk of hepatitis B infection, it is your employer's responsibility to arrange vaccination for you, rather than your GP

annotation.spannedText: If you've been exposed to the hepatitis B virus and have not been vaccinated before, you should seek medical advice immediately as you may benefit from the hepatitis B vaccine

classMention.mentionClass: If you've been exposed to the hepatitis B virus and have not been vaccinated before, you should seek medical advice immediately as you may benefit from the hepatitis B vaccine

annotation.spannedText: it's advised that a pregnant woman should have the hepatitis B vaccine if she is in a high-risk category

classMention.mentionClass: it's advised that a pregnant woman should have the hepatitis B vaccine if she is in a high-risk category

annotation.spannedText: The hepatitis B vaccine is very safe

classMention.mentionClass: The hepatitis B vaccine is very safe

annotation.spannedText: It is an inactivated (killed) vaccine, so it cannot cause the disease itself

classMention.mentionClass: It is an inactivated (killed) vaccine, so it cannot cause the disease itself
